title: Ink Master Typeface
content:
Need help finding out this typeface. Its used in the show Ink Master.  
Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Ink Master.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330063159/http:/typophile.com/files/Ink%20Master.png) | 42.29 KB |
author: nwstamina

comments.content:
Closest I have is [Centrum](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330063159/http:/www.fontspring.com/fonts/fontsite/centrum) Compressed Medium but even if the source is reliable and legal, I still feel uncomfortable as it looks very close to [Berthold City](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330063159/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/berthold+city).  
Alternatives: [Robotik](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330063159/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/robotik) and [Scriptek](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330063159/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/scriptek)

Hi Ryuk, as for Centrum, from FontSite, I too have questions. FontSite has 343 font families at Fontspring, nothing at Myfonts. I checked Centrum at Identifont and it does not exist there.  
This is all the info that Itentifont has on FontSite:  
---start quote--  
FontSite  
Web: [http://www.fontsite.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140330063159/http:/www.fontsite.com/ "http://www.fontsite.com/")  
A Web site managed by Sean Cavanaugh and Joyce Lukaczer, it sells OpenType versions of several typefaces licensed from SoftMaker GmbH, as well as some original fonts.  
Fonts published by FontSite:  
Combi Numerals Ltd  
Combi Numerals Pro  
Combi Symbols  
Combi Symbols CD  
Combi Symbols DV  
Combi Symbols PDA  
---end quote---  
The mention of SoftMaker GmbH is suspicious to me, but I don't know.  
Does anyone have any good info on the legal status of the FontSite fonts?  
Don
